comment: I highly recommend this professor. She's kind, punctual, she wants you to succeed, and she's freaking adorable. She'll take the time to help you before or after class, she engages the students, and she really cares about her job and her students' development. Her accent is thick, but if you have the opportunity to take her do so. She's very good.

Overall, Cheng is a alright teacher. Had her for CHNS 1102 prior to taking this course- her previous class was MUCH easier. Student will be expected to learn +200 characters/words for EACH of the tests- she does spring POP QUIZZES in this class. Students will make two grueling class presentations. I like Cheng as a person, but not as a teacher.
Very fair teacher! Take her if you're starting from scratch! Great patience and wll take the time to make sure you understand the material in class, but expects you to try.
Great professor. If you dont pass with a B or higher then its because you didnt go. Go to class! Attendance does count for this course, but its so easy and fun there's just no reason not to go!

I adore her. She's the sweetest teacher in the world, and aside from that, she is a great teacher. She will help you in any way she possibly can. She's super lenient on homework and attendance. I really enjoy her class. It's my favorite class of the day! Take her!

This is difficult language but Mrs. Cheng makes it fun and easy to understand. She gives homework every class that she takes up for a grade. Attendance is not mandatory but its just not smart to miss a foreign language class!

She's super nice, and really good at explaining the material. Probably one of the easiest language classes I've ever taken. She is very lenient with grading, too. You use the book a LOT, so make sure you get it and come to class. Lots of easy quizzes and three tests, including the final, and one oral presentation.
